page.title: 07CONSERVATION
page.content: The central area of Baldock, comprising Hitchin St, Church St, White Horse St, and most of High St is designated a conservation area. Baldock is one of five towns in Hertfordshire listed by the Council for British Archaeology as being of national importance. St Mary the Virgin Church is listed A1 and there are 10 Grade II*, 135 Grade II, and 29 buildings of local importance. Hitchin St and Church St contain buildings of 16th and 17th Century with timber frames and plaster work. White Horse St and High St have many buildings of the Georgian period, representing a time when the town was prosperous due to the malting and brewing industry in the town and also the development of the coaching trade on the Great North Road in the 18th C.
